TITLE: La citt√† che sale
DESCRIPTION: The City Rises by Umberto Boccioni, a 1910 painting, symbolizes the chaotic movement of the modern city under construction.
SUBJECTS: Construction site, workers, horses, smokestacks, scaffolding, buildings under construction; movement, modern lfe.
CONTENT: A dynamic city scene full of energy and movement, the rhythm and chaos of modern urban life and industrial progress as envisioned by the Futurist movement.
RIGHTS HOLDER: The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA), New York; for publications outside North America: Scala Archives, Florence, Italy
